commentTextItems.html: yorker length delivery dug out to the off side behind the wicket.

commentPostTextItems.html: Pakistan win by 23 runs and wraps the series, leads by 3-0. A hard-fought win for Pakistan, but a special mention for Bangladesh for taking it so close when most people had counted them out. But for a couple of untimely run-outs and some rash shots, they controlled this match from the 30th over of the Pakistan innings onwards, first restricting their total and then chasing hard. But at long last, a contest and both teams will be pleased with that. Bangladesh total is the highest against recognized opposition. Salman Butt for the second time picks up the Man-of-the-Match award, a wonderful knock of 132 runs of 127 balls.
Thanks for being with us, do join us for the fourth ODI on April 16. Until then this is Binoy George and along with Raymond signing off. It is bye from all of us here at Cricinfo.

dismissalComment.html: caught! Short delivery from Tanvir and Nafees goes for the pull shot and gets a top-edge to short midwicket, an easy catch for Butt.

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Ashraful run out (Fawad Alam/â€ Kamran Akmal) 16 (28b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: another run out! Plays softly to the off side and takes off for a single, Shakib Al Hasan sends him back, Fawad Alam picks up the ball and throws it to Akmal, who gets rid of the bails as Ashraful dives back into the crease but not in time.

stories.title: Akmal and Butt set up 23-run victory
stories.subTitle: Pakistan v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Lahore
stories.seoTitle: Akmal and Butt set up 23-run victory
stories.summary: A total of 309, disappointing given that Pakistan had been 151 for 0 in the 23rd over, ultimately proved sufficient as they wrapped up the series with a 23-run win

stories.title: Pakistan set to test bench strength
stories.subTitle: Pakistan v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Lahore
stories.summary: A win in Lahore tomorrow will seal the series, so the pressure falls on Bangladesh to pull off a surprise victory and stay alive in what has been a really one-sided series so far
